intro: Oxybaphus pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf broomrape, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a unique structure with a slender stem and no true leaves. It is often found growing on the roots of grasses and shrubs. Due to its parasitic nature, it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
